item.description: About I am a postdoctoral researcher in Statistics at the Department of Economics, Management and Statistics (DEMS) at the University of Milano-Bicocca (Milan, Italy), working under the supervision of Prof. Bernardo Nipoti (DEMS, University of Milano-Bicocca). I received my PhD in Statistics at the Universiy of Padova (Padova, Italy) in 2022, supervised by Prof. Antonio Canale (Department of Statistical Sciences, University of Padova) and Prof. Michele Guindani (Department of Biostatistics, UCLA).

Contact Office 2092/b, second floor U7 building. Department of Economics, Management and Statistics (DEMS) University of Milano-Bicocca Piazza dell’Ateneo Nuovo 1, 20126 Milan Email laura.dangelo@unimib.it

Publications D’Angelo L. and Denti F. (2024) A finite-infinite shared atoms nested model for the Bayesian analysis of large grouped data. Bayesian Analysis, 1–34. DOI: 10.1214/24-BA1458. Article - Citation D’Angelo L. and Canale A. (2023) Efficient posterior sampling for Bayesian Poisson regression. Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics, 32(3), 917–926. DOI: 10.1080/10618600.2022.2123337. Article - Citation D’Angelo L., Canale A., Yu Z.

Statistical Modelling course Third year course of the B.Sc. course in Artificial Intelligence (Universities of Milano-Bicocca, Milano Statale and Pavia). A.A. 2023/2024, 1st semester. 6 CFU (32 hours lectures, 24 hours exercise classes). Communications 10/01/2024: The exam will include 2 or 3 exercises (in line with the exercises seen during the course). Please bring: ✓ a calculator, ✓ ID or student card,

Statistical Modelling course Third year course of the B.Sc. course in Artificial Intelligence (Universities of Milano-Bicocca, Milano Statale and Pavia). A.A. 2024/2025, 1st semester. 6 CFU (32 hours lectures, 24 hours exercise classes). Communications Please enroll to the course on the Kiro platform to receive communications. The exam consists of 2 or 3 exercises (in line with the exercises seen during the course).

Conference presentations Invited talk: “Uncovering the heterogeneity of the neuronal activity in calcium imaging studies via Bayesian mixture models”; ISBA 2024, Venezia, Italy; July 1 - 7, 2024. Invited talk: “Two-level clustering of patients and hospitals via thinned dependent Dirichlet process mixtures”; SIS 2024, Bari, Italy; June 17 - 20, 2024. Invited talk: “A Bayesian hierarchical mixture model for clustering Spotify’s songs and artists”; StaTalk 2023, Roma, Italy; September 15, 2023.

Teaching Statistical Modelling (A.A. 2024/2025) B.Sc. course in Artificial Intelligence. Inter-university project of the Universities of Milano-Bicocca, Milano Statale and Pavia. OLD Statistical Modelling (A.A. 2023/2024) B.Sc. course in Artificial Intelligence. Inter-university project of the Universities of Milano-Bicocca, Milano Statale and Pavia.

item.title: Resume
item.description:
Current position Postdoctoral researcher at the Department of Economics, Management and Statistics (DEMS), University of Milano-Bicocca.
Education PhD student in Statistical Science 10/2018 – 11/2021, University of Padova. Thesis title: Bayesian modeling of calcium imaging data. Supervisor: Prof. Antonio Canale. Co-supervisor: Prof. Michele Guindani.
Master’s Degree in Statistics 10/2015 – 11/2017, University of Padova.
